author: dlr
msg: * www/merge-tracking/requirements.html
Add a blurb to the "Auditing" section about both original author and
merging author being shown by 'svn log'.

author: dlr
msg: * www/merge-tracking/requirements.html
Tweak title.  Update TODOs.  Flesh out "Cherry Picking" section.
Create "Auditing" section (replacing "Miscellaneous Thoughts").
Misc. formatting tweaks.
* www/merge-tracking/func-spec.html
Add TODO, indicating that the repeated-merging doc belongs here (or
possibly in the design doc).

author: rooneg
msg: Keep svn_repos_get_logs3 from using an unbounded amount of memory
when it is given multiple targets.  This fixes issue #2494.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/log.c
(path_info): Make path a stringbuf, add two new boolean flags.
(get_history): Take a pool argument, add an alternate mode of
operation where we open the history object each time instead of
holding it open.  Instead of setting info->hist to NULL when we
are done with it, set info->done.
(check_history): Take a pool argument, pass it to get_history,
use info->done instead of info->hist to tell when we're done
with a path.
(next_history_rev): Use info->done instead of info->hist to tell
when we're done with a path.
(MAX_OPEN_HISTORIES): New define that controls how many history
objects we'll keep open.
(svn_repos_get_logs3): Only open MAX_OPEN_HISTORIES histories,
for any additional paths the history will be opened as needed.
Pass pool to get_history and use info->done to determine if we
are done with a path.

author: dlr
msg: * www/merge-tracking/requirements.html
* notes/merge-tracking.txt
Dumped content from merge-tracking.txt into requirements.html (which is
not yet anywhere close to ready for review).

author: jerenkrantz
msg: ra_serf: Redeliver requests if we lose our connection.
httpd's default is to close the connection after 100 requests; so we need
to better handle having our connection pulled out from under us.
Serf will invoke the response handler with a NULL response field to indicate
that we lost our connection.
(This commit requires some forthcoming commits to serf.)
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/update.c:
(handle_fetch): Redeliver GET requests; use is_conn_closing helper to
hint to Serf that the connection is going to go away.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/property.c:
(handle_propfind): Redeliver PROPFIND requests.
(deliver_props): Normalize some argument names with their field names;
don't allocate a propfind_context_t if our prop_ctx arg is non-NULL.
(retrieve_props): Send deliver_props a NULL prop_ctx.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/util.c
(is_conn_closing): New function to see if we have Conn: Close header and
return new SERF_ERROR_CLOSING error code.
(handle_xml_parser): Use is_conn_closing() function.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/log.c:
(handle_log): Add a placeholder for now to abort() if we lose our
connection.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/getloc.c
(handle_getloc): Add a placeholder for now to abort() if we lose our
connection.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/ra_serf.h
(propfind_context_t): Add depth field.
(is_conn_closing): Declare new helper function.
